sn12.68:1.1: At one time the venerables Musīla, Saviṭṭha, Nārada, and Ānanda were staying near Kosambī in Ghosita’s monastery.
sn12.68:1.2: Then Venerable Saviṭṭha said to Venerable Musīla:
sn12.68:1.3: “Reverend Musīla, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, do you personally know that
sn12.68:1.4: rebirth is a requirement for old age and death?”
sn12.68:1.5: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, I know and see that
sn12.68:1.6: rebirth is a requirement for old age and death.”
sn12.68:2.1: “Reverend Musīla, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberateation, do you personally know that
sn12.68:2.2: continued existence is a requirement for rebirth …
sn12.68:2.3: grasping is a requirement for continued existence …
sn12.68:2.4: craving is a requirement for grasping …
sn12.68:2.5: feeling is a requirement for craving …
sn12.68:2.6: contact is a requirement for feeling …
sn12.68:2.7: the six sense fields are requirements for contact …
sn12.68:2.8: name and form are requirements for the six sense fields …
sn12.68:2.9: consciousness is a requirement for name and form …
sn12.68:2.10: choices are a requirement for consciousness …
sn12.68:2.11: ignorance is a requirement for choices?”
sn12.68:2.12: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, I know and see that
sn12.68:2.13: ignorance is a requirement for choices.”
sn12.68:3.1: “Reverend Musīla, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, do you personally know that
sn12.68:3.2: when rebirth ceases, old age and death cease?”
sn12.68:3.3: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, I know and see that
sn12.68:3.4: when rebirth ceases, old age and death cease.”
sn12.68:4.1: “Reverend Musīla, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, do you personally know that
sn12.68:4.2: when continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases …
sn12.68:4.3: when grasping ceases, continued existence ceases …
sn12.68:4.7: when the six sense fields cease, contact ceases …
sn12.68:4.8: when name and form cease, the six sense fields cease …
sn12.68:4.9: when consciousness ceases name and form cease …
sn12.68:4.12: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, I know and see that
sn12.68:5.1: “Reverend Musīla, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, do you personally know that
sn12.68:5.2: the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment?”
sn12.68:5.3: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, I know and see that
sn12.68:5.4: the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.”
sn12.68:6.1: “Then Venerable Musīla is a perfected one, with defilements ended.”
sn12.68:6.2: When he said this, Musīla kept silent.
sn12.68:7.1: Then Venerable Nārada said to Venerable Saviṭṭha,
sn12.68:7.2: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, please let me answer these questions.
sn12.68:7.4: and I will answer them for you.”
sn12.68:7.5: “By all means, Venerable Nārada, try these questions.
sn12.68:7.7: and you can answer them for me.”
sn12.68:8.1: (Saviṭṭha repeats exactly the same series of questions, and Nārada answers just as Musīla did.)
sn12.68:12.1: “Reverend Nārada, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, do you personally know that
sn12.68:12.2: the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment?”
sn12.68:12.3: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, endorsement, oral transmission, reasoned train of thought, or acceptance of a view after deliberation, I know and see that
sn12.68:12.4: the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.”
sn12.68:13.1: “Then Venerable Nārada is a perfected one, with defilements ended.”
sn12.68:13.2: “I have truly seen clearly with right wisdom that the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment. Yet I am not a perfected one.
sn12.68:13.3: Suppose there was a well on a desert road that had neither rope nor bucket.
sn12.68:13.4: Then along comes a person struggling in the oppressive heat, weary, thirsty, and parched.
sn12.68:13.5: They’d know that there was water, but they couldn’t physically touch it.
sn12.68:13.6: In the same way, I have truly seen clearly with right wisdom that the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment. Yet I am not a perfected one.”
sn12.68:14.1: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to Venerable Saviṭṭha,
sn12.68:14.2: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, what do you have to say to Venerable Nārada when he speaks like this?”
sn12.68:14.3: “Reverend Ānanda, I have nothing to say to Venerable Nārada when he speaks like this, except what is good and wholesome.”
